task_summary: The robot detects, grasps, and unfolds a wrinkled towel using two arms, finishing by retreating after releasing the towel.

task_long_description.overview: A dual-arm robot on a workspace is tasked to unfold a wrinkled towel placed on a green mat. The system first perceives the towel, then plans a grasp, manipulates the towel by pulling at key contact points to unfold it, and finally releases and retreats. The scene must support unimpeded arm motion; the main constraint is achieving a flat unfolded towel state.
preconditions: Towel is present on the workspace, wrinkled and unfolded.
Dual-arm system calibrated and grippers open.
stepwise_plan: Check towel presence/visibility; attempt reacquisition if not seen.
Move both end-effectors above appropriate grasp points.
Compute and perform 'top' grasps on towel edges.
Unfold the towel by a pull/unfold action spanning two main folds.
Release the towel with both grippers.
Retreat both arms away from the workspace.
success_criteria: Towel is spread flat with minimal visible folds or wrinkles.
No major occlusions or new wrinkles introduced.
No collision or gripping failures during the task.
failure_and_recovery: Perception failures: retry up to 3 times acquiring towel pose.
Unstable grasp: reacquire pose; reattempt grasp.
Towel stuck or occluded: abort or signal for user intervention.
task_long_description.termination: When the towel is unfolded and arms have retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is currently visible to the perception system.
Performs a grid-pattern scan to locate the towel if it is not visible.
Moves both end-effectors above the towel, preparing for a grasp.
Computes suitable grasp pose(s) for picking the towel from the top.
Performs the top grasp on the towel at computed pose.
Executes the unfolding motion by pulling across two main folds.
Opens the grippers to release the towel after unfolding.
Retracts the arms away from the unfolded towel and workspace.

failure_modes: Collision with table or other gripper
recovery_strategy: Retry perception (up to 3 times) if towel lost
Abort and signal user if collisions detected or repeated failures
assumptions: Bimanual actions are collapsed into single unfolding for brevity.
The towel is the only deformable object present.
Instruction is consistent with visible frames; direct bimanual manipulation is inferred from robot configuration.
Num_folds=2 estimated from visual evidence in frames, as two main folds are resolved in sequence.
Pull strategy inferred due to dual arm grasping and opposing motions.

expected_success_criteria: Towel is flat, unfolded, and not occluded; robot arms clear of towel.
